nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -143,9 +143,12 @@ emr_install_alluxio() {
   download_file "${alluxio_tarball}"
 
   release=$(basename "${alluxio_tarball}")
-  local release_unzip
-  release_unzip="${release%%-*}" # trims everything after the first '-', ex. alluxio-foo-bar-whatever -> alluxio
-
+  local release_prefix

nodes.bodyText:
both of these expressions seem very fragile to me :/
the original expression of converting alluxio-* -> alluxio seems unnecessarily difficult
is it not possible to trim the ".tar.gz" suffix from the tarball and use that as the directory name that the tarball unzips to?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -143,9 +143,12 @@ emr_install_alluxio() {
   download_file "${alluxio_tarball}"
 
   release=$(basename "${alluxio_tarball}")
-  local release_unzip
-  release_unzip="${release%%-*}" # trims everything after the first '-', ex. alluxio-foo-bar-whatever -> alluxio
-
+  local release_prefix
+  if [[ "${release}" == *-* ]]; then
+    release_unzip="${release%%-*}" # trims everything after the first '-', ex. alluxio-foo-bar-whatever -> alluxio

nodes.bodyText: emmm... the problem is the unzipped folder from  value.tar.gz doesn't name value
